critique: This document pertains to the Army Ration and amends Executive Order No. 5952. It removes the restriction of field rations being used "only in time of war or national emergency" and allows the Secretary of the military department concerned to prescribe procedures to meet special feeding requirements. This seems to be an administrative update to provide more flexibility in providing rations. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power changes, federalism implications, national security vs. civil liberties concerns, economic regulation, or social inclusion aspects. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
